dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Lightning McQueen, typically referred to by his surname McQueen, is an anthropomorphic stock car in the animated Pixar film "Cars

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: My neighbor's grandson loves that program. He has a toy car he calls Lightning McQueen!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: its sequels "Cars 2" (2011), "Cars 3" (2017), and TV shorts known as "Cars Toons.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What are TV shorts and is Lightning McQueen in them?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: This is a list of characters from the Pixar franchise "Cars", as well as the Disney franchise "Planes", which is set in the same fictional universe: Lightning McQueen, often referred to as "McQueen", is the main character in "Cars

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I don't see a list of characters - are you copying this from somewhere?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: LOL! Copy protection, also known as content protection, copy prevention and copy restriction, is any effort designed to prevent the reproduction of software, films, music, and other media

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Presumably you're here to discuss Lightning McQueen. Please give me some information on the topic. Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: THE inspiration of the  design is inspired by a stock car and "a more curvaceous Le Mans endurance racer," with "some Lola and some Ford GT40.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Fascinating. I must google more on this subject.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love Ice Hockey! Watching the teams of players zooming around the rink and shooting that vulcanized rubber puck into the net really gives me a thrill!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That is awesome. I don't love Hockey, but I saw that the capitals won the cup this year.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I have loved it my entire life. When i was a child, we would play street hockey in the street using roller skates and a softball for a puck.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That's awesome I would play street hockey as a kid. I grew up playing soccer.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Hockey is so popular they even made a movie about it called "Slap Shot", and another called "The  Mighty Ducks". Remember those?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love THe Mighty Ducks! They were such cool kids. Who was your favorite?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I like the third movie, "D3", where Bombay announcfes he is leaving the team to take a job with the Junior Goodwill Games.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I never went that far in the series. Can you tell me more about "D3"?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: At the beginning of the film, the ducks are awarded scholarships to Eden Hall Academy, this was after they won the Junior Goodwill Games in Los Angeles.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Really? That sounds like an interesting plot line. I feel like Los Angeles is a great spot.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: The Anaheim Ducks, a NHL team, was owned by Walt Disney who named their team after the movie.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I have been a computer repair technician for about 10 years. I repair and maintain computers and servers.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Cool, is it a tough job?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, i have to configure new hardware, create new computer networks, and updating software.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am not good at computers, did you have any training?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, I had to go to a professional institution to get a certificate to prepare me for the job. It included classroom work and on the job teaching.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Wow. Sounds like a lot of work. Did you enjoy the classroom work?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, but I enjoyed the apprenticeship even more. I got to learn my trade on actual jobs.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Thats cool. I wish I could get any apprenticeship.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: You could if you found something you really enjoyed.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I will do that. Thanks for the advice.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i used to love playing overwatch when it came ouot

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well, Overwatch is a team based multiplayer first person shooter game so I think a lot of people enjoy it (especially CoD types) but it was never my thing

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do you know the company that designed said video game?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Indeed. Overwatch was developed by Blizzard Entertainment (yes that Blizzard) and was released on Windows, PS4, and Xbox One in 2016

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Blizzard is a really awesome game company i really like their game, do you play overwatch much?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Not really. It's not my type of game even though I do like team games. Oerwatch assigns players into two teams of six, so it is definitly a team based game with offense, defenses, tank, and support roles

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah i really wish they could add new characters more often to make the game feel a little different

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well, on the plus side, players gain cosmetic rewards such as character skinds and victory poses which do not affect gameplay :p

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: The victory poses are really nice and some really funny but over all i think overwatch is a great game for all people to enjoy

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: It's interesting to note, too, that Overwatch is Blizzard's fourth major franchise and happened because the mmo Titan was cancelled in 2014

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Sleep is a naturally recurring state of mind and body, that helps us recover mentally and physically.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love to sleep.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: The internal circadian clock promotes sleep daily at night, do you ever sleep at times other than night?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes sometimes during the day.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: interesting, were you aware that the diverse purposes and mechanisms of sleep are still a mystery and are subject to ongoing research?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I did not know that. You know a lot.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I try, were you aware that REM stands for rapid eye movement?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I did know that, also a very good band.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yeah it is! relationship between sleep and memory has been studied since the 19th century!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I like to sleep as long as possible.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Have you ever participated in the scavengerhunt of geocaching?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I havent it it any fun?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: yea, you find things that are often buried that can contain treasures like toys or trinkets for traiding

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I would love to go sometime!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Usually you find a waterproff container and a logbook that you can sign and add something to it for someone else to find

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Is their good places I should go look

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: There are many websites that have locations that are GPS coordinates that help you find the locations, but usually they are public parks

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Cool I will look into it

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Have you heard of the German automobile manufacturer Porsche?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah I've heard of them.  They make sports cars, right?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yep , that why Porsche's current lineup includes the 718 Boxster/Cayman, and 911!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Are they good performing cars?  I like the sound of the one called Boxster!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes they sure are! The Porsche Boxster and Cayman are both mid-engined two-seater sports cars which you might like.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do they get decent mileage?  I heard Sports cars often get pretty bad mileage.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yea thats true, but thats the trade-off for a high performance classic German sports car

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Well I still like the Boxster.  I may see if I could find a pre-owned one!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love going to the library! There is such a large selection of good books!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Me too! There's so much there, books, newspapers, periodicals, manuscripts, maps, film, DVDs, etc. You can find anything you want!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love how the books are organized.  I learned about the Dewey Decimal System in high school, and I think it is still used today

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, I remember it from school too. It's funny how a library can really be just a few books on a shelf, all the way up to millions of items!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Somehow an e-book just isn't the same - I'd rather hold an actual book in my hands - mystery books are my favorite!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I prefer a book in my hand too. When I think back to the first libraries, having the first forms of writing, like the clay tablets in cuneiform script, it seems amazing to me. Some of them even dated back to 2600BC....can you imagine holding that?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Wow!  It would be rather heavy if it's made of clay! What an interesting way to create something to be read!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: It is, and so primitive to now. Personal libraries with written books were first noted in Greece in the 5th centry BC, so long books have been very important!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i love cookies

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I like them and my daughter is addicted. A cookie is a baked food that is small, flat and sweet but I'm sure you know that haha

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: My favorite type is chocolate chip, i have always wanted to prepare a good cookie but always seem to bun them

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do that too, a lot. What's fun is you can use all types of ingredients like raisins,oats, chocolate, and nuts among other things

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I will defenetly have to try the raisins cookies sounds really good

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I think it's funny everywhere except US and Canada call crisp cookies biscuits.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: hahahah i think  i will go to the store later to buy some doe and see if i can cook them right this time

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Or you could always buy mass produced cookies from factories. Although, small batch or homemade cookies do tend to be best

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah but i find them a little bad once they spent a lot of time in the container

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yeah they don't seem to last long but my kids don't give them a chance to get stale. They are good with a drink like milk or coffee

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: My friend likes to collect stamps. He has some that are 100 years old!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That is awesome. Stamp collecting is a great hobby as there are always new and different stamps available.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah, I am always interested in the different kinds of stamps used around the world.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Me too, I would love to have some old stamps that were issued in the 1840 when some one the worlds first stamps were issued.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I think the US started using stamps with the Postal Service was started. The Pony Express was amazing.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes I believe you are correct. The pony express sadly only operated for 19 months

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: It must have been very difficult due to travel through wilderness and Indian country.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes it must have been. I wonder if that had some help in forming Wells Fargo?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Are you colorblind having decreased ability to see color or differences in color?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am not colorblind but I have met people who are.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Achromatopsia is known as total color blindness

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Wow! I never knew the name for it. I wonder how exactly people with Achromatopsia view the world?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: It is very severe and I believe they see the world in shades of gray.  Work is in progress for gene therapy.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: If gene therapy results in success, I believe that people with Achromatopsia will feel like it's a whole new world filled with brightness and beauty!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes.  For those with partial color blindness it will provide increased job opportunities.  It affects many people, especially males.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, the people I've met with color blindness have been male. I do hope scientific advances increases all kinds of opportunities.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, some animal gene projects have been successful.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That sounds very promising!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Sculpture is the branch of the visual arts that operates in three dimensions do you know any thing about it?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I have heard of sculpting. Do you know any famous sculptures?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Cubist sculpture

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I see, what else do you know about this?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Cubist sculpture developed in parallel with Cubist painting, beginning in Paris around 1909

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That was a long time ago. What does a cubist sculpture involve?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Cubist sculpture is rooted in Paul Cézanne's reduction of painted objects into component planes and geometric solids; cubes, spheres, cylinders, and cones

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: When was Paul Cézanne born? He sounds like a famous person I should know about.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I really like dogs. They are the most widely abudant carnivores!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love dogs but I've never had one! Are there many different breeds?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well there are 337 pure bred dog breed that are recognized.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Holy cow! That's a lot! What's a good dog breed to have as a pet?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well if you live on farm an Australian Cattle Dog they are really good herding dogs and can cover long distances!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That sounds like a good breed! Dogs are such smart animals, aren't they? It seems like they can be trained for so many different tasks!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yeah they have played lots of roles like hunting, assisting police and even a role in the military.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That's so cool! What other neat facts can you tell me about dogs?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well they come in all shapes and sizes!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: And they seem to have different coats, don't they? I've seen dogs with short, wiry hair and other with long, soft coats.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I don't know a lot about the actor Jason Mraz but I did see him in a Broadway show, Waitress which was amazing!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I kind of know who he is, I think his first hit was The Remedy, that was a while ago though.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Was that a film or a television show? I haven't heard of it before.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: It is a song, Jason Mraz is from my recollection a songwriter.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh, I had no idea. lol What other songs is he known for writing?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Only other one I can think of is "I'm Yours".  It is a good one though!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Is he still writing songs today?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Not really sure to be honest, his last album I know of is Love is a Four Letter Word was apparently in 2012.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: You know what? I really like the color blue.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love pastel colors.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That is very interesting.  Those colors show a person who is creative!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: They remind me of the 1980's

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh yes the tie dye era! But did you know that blue symbolizes truth and confidence?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Tie-die was teh 1960's The 1980's were pink and blue pastel colors.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh ok I got that mixed up! I am a 60's baby!  I guess I am partial to blue because it is peaceful...

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I was born in the mid 70's so came of age right when the bright neon colors started.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: And now it would seemed that during this era that pretty much anything goes!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Super bright neon lights of all colors are the thing now.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I really like basketball, how did it get invented?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Good question, it was invented in 1891 by Dr James Naismith

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: oh wow that long ago.  Is it popular here in America?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: For which, basketball in general or one-on-one or two-on-two or what?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: basketball in general.  Where is it popular?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I am not really sure on some of these things, after it was invented in 1891 by Dr James Naismith, I assume everywhere. Mainly the US

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: How is it played?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: To start, the objective is to shoot a ball though a hoop in diameter and high that is mounted to a backboard at each end of the court. Thinking about it I'm saying for sure US

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Cat are the best animal ever, Don't you agree?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I am more of a dog person, but I appreciate cats for their companionship and ability to hunt vermin.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes, I have herd dogs are smarter. But they also want more attention. My cat and I visit at meals like people then do our own thing. Do you have a dog?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: No.  Actually, I am allergic to both cats and dogs so I don't have pets.  To interesting your relationship with your cat.  They are solitary animals but also like communicating through mewing, purring, grunting, etc.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That's sad. You can always get a digital pet like we had in the 90s

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That's so funny.  Maybe I should get a digital pet or virtual pet as a companion.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: A tomodachi. How about fish?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Tomodachi Life is great.  Maybe Is should look into that Nintendo game or...a fish would work for me as well.  Great Suggestions!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I had fish love them.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Should I get an aquarium or maybe a fish pond or garden pond?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I used to do weight training and I used to be fit. Do you like strength training?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I'm planning on starting in the next few months, but right now I'm working on cardio.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I actually like doing HIT training now. It's a high intensity training . The exercises are short, infrequent and intense. Makes your heart rate go up and  you burn more calories

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Can you tell me more about that kind of training?  Does it require any special equipment?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do it at the gym so they have all the equipment but I'm pretty sure you can do it at home too with no equipment.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Is it good for cardio and weight lifting?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: It's kind of both! For example you do 40 seconds of running in one place and then 10 seconds rest. Then you pick up dumbbells and do bicep curls for 40 seconds and then 10 seconds rest and so on.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: OH I understand now - kind of like circuit training?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: My dad is a roofer and wants me to work for him but I dont know much about it

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Does he concentrate on the application of materials that waterproof.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah I think he does. He has been doing it forever

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: He must have good motor skills.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah he sometimes climbs houses without support lines

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: In Australia they are called roof carpenters.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I think I have heard them called that before

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: They are often also called roofing contractors.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I vividly remember my first swimming lessons- did you ever take them yourself?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes~ I love to swim.  Infants can hold their breath underwater and do basic swimming at only a few weeks old?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That is incredible- treading water was the first thing we learned. I was probably three!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That's amazing. So many countries have minimum swimming levels kids have to know - they even teach in school!  US needs that, too.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Agreed! I always teach my students to float on their backs and tread water first. You cannot fight a current and these skills save lives!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Great life lessons to save lives.  When swimming you can rely on your body's natural buoyancy, and save your life!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: And swimming is so, so great for physical therapy patients of all ages and just as exercise in general! Low impact is where it's at!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes something that can be done at any age without impact like land activities (running). Much better for your body!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love 80's progressive rock bands.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Can you give me some examples of one?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Like Toto or YES.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I'm not familiar with those at all.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Toto is an American band. I'm sure you have heard their song Africa.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I probably have. I can recognize songs but not sure who sings them.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: It has been a popular meme for a few years now.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh Ok, that's interesting. I'm sure I have seen it.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Weezer just did a big cover of it.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Now, I definitely know who Weezer is.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: My favorite actor is Robert De NIro, do you like him? Have any favorite movies?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love taxi driver! Robert was born August 17 1943,

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Cool! I don't think I've seen that one, what's it about?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: A taxi driver who gets tired of seeing crime, His longtime collaboration with director Martin Scorsese earned him the Academy Awards.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Neat! Sounds like an interesting plot. I like "The Godfather", he was excellent in that movie.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: He was great in that, He received the AFI Life Achievement Award in 2003 for all his work.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Wow! I bet he has received a lot of rewards throughout his career.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well De Niro received additional nominations for Michael Cimino's Vietnam war drama "The Deer Hunter"  It was a great movie as well.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I have always wanted to try Scuba Diving.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: So have I! I know that it involves having a underwater breathing apparatus, which sounds a bit annoying to be carrying around under there.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I've heard that it's compressed air I wonder what's that like.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, it is compressed air! It allows greater independence and freedom of movement when they have the tank with them as opposed to surface-supplied divers.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh wow, they can also be open circuit right?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes they can! These discharge the gas into the environment as you breathe out.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: tell me more.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well closed-circuit, on the other hand, allow recycling of gases that you breathe out into the environment.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Which one is better?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Neither are really better, since they are better at different things. Another thing is rebreathers, as they extend the amount of time that you can spend underwater.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Pizza is very popular.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes I like pizza myself.  What is your favorite kind of pizza?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love brick oven baked pizzas.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I like stuffed crust or New York style.  What kind of toppings do you like on your pizza?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I like the meats, with extra cheese.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I like pepperoni, sausage and bacon as well.  Not a big fan of veggies or pineapple on a pizza.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Some of the cheeses can be high in proteins depending on the source; cow, goat, sheep.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes I don't mind mozzarella at all, I have sprinkled cheddar on it as well.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love the novel A Song of Ice and Fire.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I haven't yet read the epic fantasy novel by George R. R. Martin.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I highly recommend the series if you enjoy the fantasy genre.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Have you read the 5th and most recent volume in the series? It's "A Dance with Dragons."

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I have not, I've only recently started reading the series due to the TV show.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: The author's inspiration for the series came from Wars of the Roses.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: So I've read. He was also inspired by French history novels such as The Accursed Kings by Maurice Druon.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes and that was a sequence of 7 historical novels by French author Maurice Druon.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: After I finish reading the series, I'll try reading those as well to see how much influence it had over Martin's own work.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I might have to try both series as well!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am a big fan of Frank Ocean. Do you know him?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do not believe I've heard of him before, but his real name is Christoper Edwin Breaux.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do you know what his first single was?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I think he released his mixtape "Nostalgia, Ultra" in 2011.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yep! I haven

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: And then from that he had his first charting single "Novacane"

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Novacane is a great song! One of my favorites by him.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Did you like his studio album "Channel Orange" that was released in July 2012?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I enjoy going fishing on my free time.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: me too, i really like it, i do it for pleasure or competition, i like going fishing with my friends also

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What equipment do you need when preparing for a recreational fishing trip?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: you can do it with a rod, reel, line, hooks and any one of a wide range of baits, thats why its so interesting for me

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Are worms used as bait for recreational fishing?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, of course, terminal tackle is also used to affect or complement the presentation of the bait to the targeted fish

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What are some recreational fishing techniques?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: There is a thing called big-game fishing is conducted from boats, they catch larger fish, but i dont like that kind of fishing

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I get sad a lot. My mood is always low and it's affecting my daily life.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Why's that? Have you tried seeking help at all?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: My grandma died, and I am very depressed. I haven't sought any help because I think it's temporary and I might get over it.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That is upsetting, I'm sorry to hear that. Yes, it will take some time to get over it, sometimes talking about it helps.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I feel guilty and angry because I wasn't there for her when she needed me.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Well don't beat yourself up over it, there isn't anything you change about that now. I'm sure your grandma loved you deeply.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I've been contemplating suicide recently, and I have trouble concentrating. I hope I can overcome this feeling.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Definitely do not do that! You should seek help, there are trained professionals who can help you deal with this.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: When the moon passes between the Sun and Earth and the moon fully or partially blocks the Sun, it is called a solar eclipse.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That's amazing. I saw two solar eclipse before.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Did you see "The Great American Eclipse" which happened this past August 21st?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes I did. I watched it with a special reflective mirror. Did you?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I only saw it on the news. Before this event, no solar eclipse had been visible across the entire contiguous United States since 1918.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: It was a once in a life time chance to see.  Do you know the next time this event will take place?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I believe the next solar eclipse will not occur until April 8th of 2024.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That is not too far away.  Will you try to see it?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I will try as it will be visible across North America.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Great! Natural event are something that must be seen in person.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I really love mushroom ravioli. It's like a dumpling with filling in the middle.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love mushrooms and I like ravioli. So I assume I would like it also.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: It is amazing. You can eat it with a broth or with sauce over it.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I would probably do sauce.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do love sauce. The ravioli's are usually square shaped but they can be made circular too.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I like raviloi's that are squares.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I really love ravioli with ricotta cheese in the middle, which is made from sheep milk

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Ricotta cheese is my favorite cheese.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am interested in learning about the Hindu religion. Can you tell me anything about it?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well Hinduism is a way of life, or an Indian Dharma, practiced mainly in South Asia.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I see. What is the central beliefs for Hindus? I heard cows are considered sacred.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, the slaughter of cows is prohibited in most states of India

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Ok, that is a law I can respect. I do enjoy Indian food a lot. It is great for vegetarians!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I really like Curry, all different types of them since there is such a variety

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yeah chicken curry and rice is great. I also like panak paneer. Great stuff!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love chicken curry with mango chutney and chili peppers

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i have a 1 year old son. parenting isnt easy!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do not have kids and have only helped with cousins an siblings, but I still agree with you that parenting is very hard.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i feel like i don't even know what to do sometimes

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: There are no static rules to follow, and the child you raise is made different than everyone else. Society also plays a role in this as well I think.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i agree with you. I know some people don't believe in spanking but i definitely do

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I was spanked when I was younger and I didn't mind it because I was a mischievous kid sometimes. It wasn't life threatening or anything.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: as long as people spank their kids to discipline them and not to hurt them or bruise them i'm fine with that

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I agree, some countries outlawed spanking except for by parents. The goal of hurting a child is completely separate from spanking them for discipline in my opinion.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i agree. I was born in Soviet Russia, kids were allowed to be spanked at a daycare and school

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: OK I don't know much about Russian culture but discipline seems valued and important over there, so I'm not surprised. I think part of the goal is to teach right and wrong.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Bacon is one of my favorite foods! I love it on hamburgers especially. Do you like bacon?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love bacon especially for breakfast with some pancakes and eggs.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I like it with eggs too! I also like it wrapped around shrimp.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I feel like we should have a full cook book of just bacon recipes.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes! I would buy it. Unfortunately I'm not good at cooking bacon. I can never get it to cook evenly.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Either way bacon makes everything taste good. Even veggies or fruits in some cases.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I've never had it with fruit! What fruit does it go well with?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That and fruits and veggies are more healthier than straight bacon so it does help health-wise.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: True. I believe it's okay as long as it's in moderation.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Fruits and veggies do help with overall health though.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I had a domestic cat

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What kind of cat did you have?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I had a white cat. Cat are typically furry mammals

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What other kinds of mammals do we keep as pets?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Cats are valued companions of humans

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Are there other breeds of domestic cats?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, but I don't know them. Cats can hear sounds too faint or too high frequency for humans

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What do cats eat?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I want to be the worlds best swimmer!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: You must be good at holding your breath under water then!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I feel like I am! Why... Is that a prerequisite?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well you need to be able to hold your breathe while stroking! But good for you, I mean swimming is one of the lower impact sports out there!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: So I've heard!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well, as a formalized sport, swimming features in a range of local, national, and international competitions, including every modern summer Olympics. Have you competed in any of these levels?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I have not- but I hope to make tryouts this week for my local team!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well do you live in one if the countries where swimming is a compulsory part of the educational curriculum?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: NO BUT I WISH!!!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Just make sure you got your locomotion (coordinated movement of the limbs) down pact!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I know a ton of really popular luxury fashion companies, but Louis Vuitton, which was founded in 1854, is the one that I know the most about.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: oh that's fantastic, I like Louis Vuitton, It's just that their bags are exclusively  for the rich because of their high price tag

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Oh definitely, I always know that when I see their signature LV monogram on something it is either ridiculously expensive or fake.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I learnt their  products from countries like Hong Kong go through strict quality control and anti piracy laws so you hardly get a fake there

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: That's probably really nice then. It makes sense, since they sell most of their products through standalone boutiques so it must be easy to know where to get a real one.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: yes very true.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: The company is really successful this way too, since in 2012 it was valued at $25.9 billion.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: How many countries do they have their exclusive boutiques in ?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: They're in a ton of different countries, it's a total of 50 worldwide!

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I have never been skating, but it looks like great fun. Do you skate?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I used to Inline skates when I was young. They were a different type of roller skate.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I've never heard of that. What does it involve?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Well the inline skate has 2-5 wheels in a single line, wheres the quad skate have two front and two rear wheels.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I've seen them but didn't know what they were called. It must be much more difficult than regular roller skating.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Its easier than it looks really. Some inline skates will have a rubber brake on the back for recreational users.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I'd certainly make use of that brake, lol! Are their competitions relating to inline skating?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: There are all types including tricks and races. The modern inline skate was made as a substitute to ice skates. The Russian athletes used then to train when ice was not an option.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love YOUTUBE!  YouTube is an American video-sharing website

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What do you mostly watch on youtube?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I like Buzzfeed mainly, The service was created by three former PayPal employees

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Is Buzzfeed on you tube? the Paypal employees created Buzzfeed or you tube?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Chad Hurley, Steve Chen, and Jawed Karim created youtube, they are all former youtube employees

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: You mean former Paypal employees, I guess. And when was you tube founded?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: That was in 2005, in 2006  Google bought the site in November 2006 for US$1.65 billion

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Did Goggle bought the site from the three founders?  If so, do you know if they founded something else with the money they got?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Hi! I love giant pandas, they are my favourite animal. they're also called "big bear cat" sometimes? how about you?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: i love pandas, mostly their colours

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: they're easily recognized by the distinct patches around their eyes.. a few live near me, in the toronto zoo

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: wow i will love to see them, so can you tell me more

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: there are only 49 giant pandas living in captivity outside of China so it's very special. They love to roll around and eat bamboo, so cute!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: besides china, where can we see panda?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: i saw some at the san diego zoo once. and toronto. besides that, they're in 15 other countries

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: really, can you tell me one

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Girls are so strange. I meet a girl a month ago, we hit it off, we start dating, and then two days later she randomly breaks up with me for no given reason.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Well you know what they say, there's always more fish in the sea. Perhaps you did something to upset her without realizing it.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Funny you should say that, because she said we could start over a little slower about a week later but then she did the exact same thing.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Ooph, rough. Have you been in many relationships before?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Not at all, that was my first "real" relationship. What about you?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I've been in a few, but they haven't lasted past a few months. I wonder if there's a psychology unique to women, do you know anything about that?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Not specifically that, but I do know that duration of courtship varies greatly depending on location, so it can be culture-related too.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Hm, that's true. Some places even have arraigned marriages where the people don't really have a choice, pretty crazy.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, arranged marriages with the family's approval are not as common but not unheard of, especially in places like India.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: There's still a long way to go with equal rights I guess, it's unfortunate, but hopefully progress is being made.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do you know much about what EuroBasket?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Do you mean the European Basketball Championship?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes I think that's what it stands for. What is it?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: It is a basketball competition contested biannually.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds really cool. I love basketball. It's fascinating to watch.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I prefer basketball in Israel due to the multi-tiered clubs.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I didn't know it was done differently there. I'd like to research that. It sounds interesting.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yea but I wish I could of been at thie first Euro Championship in 1935.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I would have loved that too but I wasn't even born yet. I don't even think my grandpa was at that time.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yea, Switzerland was the first host country so probably too far to of gone to anyway.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I work in a corner grocery store during the day.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Does your store primarily sell food?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes we sell food and household products. I recently started working there but I don't know much about grocery stores yet. Do you?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do not. I have never worked in a grocery store before. How large is the store?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: It's an average size with a produce section, butcher and deli. Do you know when grocery stores became popular?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Wasn't it Vincent Astor who founded Astor Market in 1915? Before that I believe it was always a clerk who prepped your order from a counter.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: It seems like we're going back to that old way in a sense, with online grocery ordering and preparing you can just pick up your groceries prepared by a personal shopper. Do you know much about technology in grocery stores?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: As far as online ordering technology? Just that there is a delivery charge and it's convenient.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do you know what the biggest grocery store chain is?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I don't, but I see Walmarts everywhere. I think they have something like 11,000 or more stores and are in multi countries.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Hello!  What made you decide to become a lifeguard?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Lifeguards are rescuers who ensure the safety and rescue of swimmers

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Sounds cool!  What type of education do you need to become a lifeguard?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: National Lifeguard education is designed to develop an understanding of "lifeguarding" principles, good judgment and a mature and responsible attitude

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Okay.  How long does the process take?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: It depends. Lifeguards are strong swimmers and trained in CPR/AED first aid, certified in water rescue using a variety of aids and equipment

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: So it sounds like someone who wants the job has to be highly motivated.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Lifeguards can be part of the emergency services system to incidents and in some communities, the lifeguard service also carries out mountain rescues, or may function as EMS.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Wow, I would never think of a lifeguard on a mountain!  Are there many EMS's that also do lifeguard work, as well?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Lifeguards can take on this responsibility upon employment, although they can also be volunteers.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love beetroot, that is  the taproot portion of the beet plant

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am not familiar with it.  What do you do with beetroot.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Most times it is grown for their edible taproots and their leaves

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: do you cook it prior to eating it?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: That depends on the use because Many beet products are made from other "Beta vulgaris" varieties

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Are they bitter?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do not think so because beets have use as a food colouring

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Thank you for your information.  I learned something new.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love comic books. They are easy to read and the stories are pretty good.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: This is also known as magazine. What I like about them is the art forms that are used to tell different scenes and characters

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Indeed there are so many comic book styles, more than in writing novels.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, you see that they are arranged in panels with a description that looks like the heading and different narratives

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Pretty much. If you don't scroll too fast you can really be surprised by the script.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Their origin is very interesting as they can be traced to 18th century Japan and 1830s Europe but  it was when they got to the USA that they became popular in the 1930s

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I am sure they were very different before the rules got standardized.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: The first comic in the United States was Famous Funnies and it was released in 1933

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I've never seen it but it would interesting. I wonder how much things have changed since.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: How a comic appears is dependent on how the company making it is and the appearance

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: yes

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I just love dogs. I have a husky of my own.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Do you like dogs? Their origin is pretty interesting, their closest relative is a gray wolf.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yes, mine is part wolf, in fact. He's also a super hyper dog. Getting into everything.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Wow, that is really cool! What do huskies like to do? Any wolf like instincts that you have noticed?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Definitely the hunter instinct. Also learns very smart. They're big fans of running in general, working type dogs. Likes to herd the grandkids also.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That's really cute! Your dog is pretty active and energetic, right? Do they shed a lot?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh. I get enough fur off of him every other day to make a wool coat.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Haha! I'm used to dogs with more of a short coat, but shed all the time. I would be curious to see what the fur looks like.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: It's verse thick type fur. Almost like a polyester fiber.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Do you have to get your dog groomed all the time or do you groom your own dog?

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Nothing is more relaxing to me then art. Drawing particularly. Do you like drawing? I'm a big fan of charcoal.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I love to draw with pencils but I am not very good at it

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Art is in the eye of the beholder. If you think it looks good, It looks good.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes drawing has been popular throughout history - even in caves

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I wonder was it a way to communicate in caves not just for pleasure?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I am not sure but it is one of the simplest means of communicating

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Interesting. I never looked of it as a way communication.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes hieroglyphics are a very basic form of drawing which communicated ideas

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I volunteer feeding the homeless in my spare time.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: That is amazing! A lot of soup kitchens are in lower-income neighborhoods and rely on volunteers like you.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: How do soup kitchens obtain their food?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: They usually get it from a food bank at a discounted price.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do most soup kitchens only serve soup, or other food items as well?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Many soup kitchens only serve soup and bread, but some serve other foods.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: What are the origins of the soup kitchen?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Unofficially, there have been some forms of soup kitchens around for thousands of years, but the modern conception came about in the late 18th century.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Do you know where the largest soup kitchen is located?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: No, but by the late 19th century, they were in many American and European cities.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love Jim Carrey hes such a talented actor, Do you know who he is?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I do!  I first saw him on the show "In Living Color" in 1990.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: That was a great movie, I always wanted to visit him in person and get an autograph, Does Jim Carrey do autographs?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I'm not certain if he does autographs or not.  The last movie that I remember him in was "A Christmas Carol" in 2009.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I think he has some of the best comedy films in my opinion, What are some of his best movies?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: I think some of the obvious ones are his best . . . . "Dumb and Dumber", "Liar Liar", and "The Mask."

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I agree those are my faves, I have all of them on DVD, Isnt he getting old now? How old is Jim Carey?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: He was born on January 17, 1962, so he's 56 now.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh thats not too old, He looks pretty great for his age.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Wizard
dialogue.text: Yes, he probably stays in great shape due to his high energy slapstick performance style.

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Do you like to eat fish or any type of seafood?

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: I love sea food so good, love fish and oysters and stuff

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I recently learned that seaweeds and microalgae is also classified as seafood! I thought it was only fish!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Oh yea makes sense since they use seaweed in sushi

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Good point! I eat a few types of fish and shellfish, but not too often.

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Same but i love some fresh sea food anytime

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: I live near the beach and our seafood in the local restaurants is so fresh! I really should eat it more, it's high in protein!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yea and it tastes amazing

dialogue.speaker: 0_Wizard
dialogue.text: Thankfully sea mammals are no longer on the menu. I can't imagine eating a whale or a dolphin, but people used to!

dialogue.speaker: 1_Apprentice
dialogue.text: Yea haha seems cruel.
